The company acquired Secureworks in February 2025, bringing together two pioneers that have redefined the cybersecurity industry with their innovative, native AI-optimized services, technologies and products. Sophos is now the largest pure-play Managed Detection and Response (MDR) provider, supporting more than 28,000 organizations. In addition to MDR and other services, Sophos' complete portfolio includes industry-leading endpoint, network, email, and cloud security that interoperate and adapt to defend through the Sophos Central platform. The solutions are powered by historical and real-time threat intelligence from Sophos X-Ops and the newly added Counter Threat Unit (CTU). Sophos is headquartered in Oxford, U.K. More information is available at www.sophos.com. Role Summary As an intern on the engineering team, you will be working closely with developers, QA engineers, and the Development Manager to help build and deliver innovative features that protect millions of users every day from cyber threats. Depending on your experience, interests, and how your skills develop during the term, you may have the opportunity to explore more advanced development tasks. You'll be part of a supportive engineering team that uses modern tools, technologies, and industry best practices. The team values continuous learning and improvement, and you'll be encouraged to contribute to that culture as you grow in the role. The position requires full-time availability (40 hours per week) and may follow a remote, hybrid, or onsite work structure, depending on the candidate's location and team requirements. The internship/co-op term will be either 4, 8 or 12 months, depending on the selected candidate's availability and interest.
